pageContext.description:
The panel consists of ten square fields arranged in two rows, which are separated by broad black lines. These contain an accompanying text in gold under each depicted commandment. The electoral coats-of-arms are represented in the bottom corners and are linked by a transparent rainbow, which at times extends over individual scenes. 

[Görres, CDA 2012]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 160 x 340 cm
[Friedländer, Rosenberg 1979, No. 77, 85]
pageContext.inscription:
- from the top left to the bottom right (each beneath a painted scene):
'Du solt kei frembde gott an betten'
'Du solt gots name nit unnutz in dein munt nemen'
'Du solt den feihr tag hailigen'
'Du solt vatter und mutter eren'
'Du solt niemant do(e)tten'
'Du solt nit stehlen'
'Du solt nit unkeusch sein'
'Du solt kein falsch gezeugnus geben'
'Du solt keins andern gemahel begeren'
'Du solt kains andern gutt begeren'
[Görres, CDA 2012]

involvedPersons.name: Lucas Cranach der Ältere
involvedPersons.remarks:
'exaggerated Cranach style'
'The composition however, are original and ingenious and were evidently conceived by Cranach'
[Friedländer, Rosenberg 1979, No. 77, 85]

metadata.title: The Ten Commandments

pageContext.provenance:
- originally on loan from the City of Wittenburg, then transferred to the Lutherhaus Collection
[Lutherhaus Wittenberg, revised 2012]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
Vorzustandsdokumentation zur Konservierung und Restaurierung der Zehn-Gebote-Tafel von Lucas Cranach d.Ä.
[...]
- convex warping of the 13 horizontal planks, particularly the outer third either side of the panel 
- the centre of the panel is reinforced with an original cross-member 
- due to the tendency of the panel to warp old splits and joins have opened and new splits have formed  
- six pine wood batten are glued to the reverse of the panel at intervals of 50-59 cm and fixed with hardwood blocks that have been nailed to the panel 
- during an extensive restoration campaign in 1972 the lighter areas of paint were cleaned more intensely than the mid-tones and dark areas where the discoloured varnish was left 
[...]

restorationSurveys.remarks:
- a backboard was attached to the reverse to stabilise the panel 
- losses in the paint layer were retouched 
[Lutherhaus Wittenberg, revised 2012]

tests.text: - 13 horizontally aligned planks, joins glued, ranging in width from 8.4-14.4 cm

Original frame:  
- a groove of c. 1 cm depth runs around the entire frame 
- there are two rings wrought out of iron bands attached to the upper member 
- there are numerous splits in the frame caused by the movement of the panel and warping in the planks, these have been reinforced with nails, particularly in the left and bottom members. 
[Holger Mantzke, 8.5.1998]

Identification of wood species:
- panel: fir wood (Abies alba)
- original frame: fir wood (Abies alba)
[Peter Klein, letter from 28.9.1998]

1.
DESCRIPTION

Tools/Material: 
- fluid black medium and brush 

Type/Ductus: 
- relatively detailed and freehand underdrawing  
- thin lines  
- occasional hatching-strokes

Funktion: 
- relatively binding fort he final painted version; lines delineate the contours and describe the essential details and the facial features; some representation of volume (hatching-strokes)

Deviations: 
- alterations made during the painting process to clearly define forms; numerous small and larger changes 

INTERPRETATION

Attribution: 
- Lucas Cranach the Elder
 
2.
DESCRIPTION

Tools/Material: 
- fluid black medium and brush 

Type/Ductus: 
- relatively detailed and freehand underdrawing  
- thin lines  

Funktion: 
- relatively binding for the final painted version; lines delineate the contours and describe the essential details and the facial features; minimum representation of volume 

Deviations: 
- alterations made during the painting process to clearly define forms; numerous small and larger changes, the chain of beads was not carried out in the painted version  

INTERPRETATION

Attribution: 
- Lucas Cranach the Elder

Type/Ductus: 
- relatively detailed and freehand underdrawing  
- thin lines  

Funktion: 
- relatively binding for the final painted version, in areas only a rough indication of form (bedcovers); lines delineate the contours and describe the essential details and the facial features; no representation of volume 

Deviations: 
- alterations made during the painting process to clearly define forms; numerous changes, the tassels on the pillow were not carried out in the painted version

- thin lines  

Funktion: 
- relatively binding for the final painted version; lines delineate the contours and describe the essential details and the facial features; no representation of volume 

Deviations: 
- alterations made during the painting process to clearly define forms; numerous changes, the coins on the table were only partially carried out in the painted version, the  strut between the table legs was omitted

INTERPRETATION

Attribution: 
- Lucas Cranach the Elder

[Smith, Sandner, Heydenreich, cda 2012]

pageContext.signature:
Central field, centre: the figure of the 'Lier' in the foreground on the right holds a document in his hands containing an illegible text ending with the date '1516'.
[Görres, CDA 2012]
